metadata.Title: CVE-2014-125043 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
** REJECT ** DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER. ConsultIDs: none. Reason:This candidate was withdrawn by its CNA. Further investigation showed thatit was not a security issue. Notes: none.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-125043` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-networkmanager-1.0 - 1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4
gir1.2-nm-1.0 - 1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4
libnm-glib-vpn1 - 1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4
libnm-glib4 - 1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4
libnm-util2 - 1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4
libnm0 - 1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4
network-manager - 1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4
network-manager-config-connectivity-debian - 1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4
network-manager-config-connectivity-ubuntu - 1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: network-manager package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-2ubuntu1.4').
